Description: Landscape with the Rest on the Flight into Egypt, record of the painting in Notre Dame University (Indiana), from the Liber Veritatis; in foreground Mary and the Christ child attended to by an angel, beyond Joseph at left and a donkey on bank of water at r, on far bank at right ruins Pen and brown ink and brown wash, with grey-brown wash, heightened with white
Curator's comments: See 1957,1214.6 for information on the Liber Veritatis. The Rest on the Flight to Egypt was a favoured subject of Claude’s, and he depicted it in several drawings and paintings. This, however, is the first occasion on which it appears in his Liber Veritatis (on which see 1957,1214.6). The painting that this drawing records was made for Cardinal Giorio in 1639, whose elevation to Cardinal in 1643 serves as a terminus post quem for the addition of the identifying inscription. The painting is now in Notre Dame Art Gallery, Indiana (Roethlisberger 1961, no. LV38, pp.168–69). Lit: M. Roethlisberger, Claude Lorrain, The Paintings, London 1961, LV38, pp.168–69; M. Roethlisberger, ‘Claude Lorrain. The Drawings’, Berkeley & Los Angeles, 1968, no. 341, pp.164–65; M. Kitson, ‘Claude Lorrain: Liber Veritatis’, London 1978, no. 38.
Bibliographic references: Liber Veritatis 1978 / Claude Lorrain: Liber Veritatis (38)

Previous owner/ex-collection: Victor Christian William Cavendish, 9th Duke of Devonshire
